names.pinyin: zhuang yao qu feng zhen tong tang
names.english: strengthen the low back, dispel wind and relieve pain decoction
names.commonEnglish: Strengthen the Low Back, Dispel Wind and Relieve Pain Decoction

actions: Dispels Wind-Dampness, unblocks the channels and alleviates pain.
With Qiang Huo, for Wind-Damp Bi causing joint pain.
With Du Huo, for low back pain or leg pain.
Tonifies Kidney Yang, strengthens the sinews and bones and aids the smooth flow of Qi and Blood.
Tonifies the Liver and Kidneys, strengthens the sinews and bones, expels Wind-Dampness and relieves Bi syndrome.
Nourishes Liver and Kidney Yin.
Expels Wind-Cold-Dampness, unblocks painful obstruction, alleviates pain and guides Qi to the Tai Yang and Du channels.
With Chuan Xiong, for headaches and generalized body aches and pains associated with the common cold or painful obstruction.
With Du Huo, for Wind-Dampness.
Dispels Wind-Dampness and alleviates pain.
With Qiang Huo, for Joint pain and numbness.
Expels Wind-Dampness, opens the channels and soothes the sinews and collaterals.
Invigorates the Blood, promotes the movement of Qi, expels Wind and alleviates pain.
Strongly unblocks the channels and extinguishes Wind.
With Qiang Huo and Qin Jiao, for Wind-Cold with migratory joint pain.
Tracks down Wind, unblocks the collaterals and stops pain.
With Wu Gong, for Wind-Damp Bi pain.
Unblocks the collaterals and stops pain.
With Du Huo and Wei Ling Xian, for stubborn Bi.
Disperses Cold, scours out Wind, overcomes Dampness and stops pain.
Expels Wind-Dampness, disperses Cold, warms and activates the channels and stops pain.

With Quan Xie, warms the channels and collaterals, disperses Cold, expels Wind and Dampness, unblocks the collaterals and stops pain to treat stubborn painful obstruction with severe symptoms due to Wind, Dampness and/or Cold.
Dispels Wind-Dampness
Disperses Cold
Unblocks the channels
Tonifies Kidney Yang
Strengthens the sinews and bones
Aids the smooth flow of Qi and Blood
Alleviates pain
syndromes: Kidney Yang Deficiency with Wind-Cold-Dampness and Qi Stagnation

symptoms: Dull, lingering low back pain which feels cold, weak and aching and is worse with overwork and improved by lying down, rest, pressure warmth and massage
Weakness of the lower limbs which sometimes prevents walking or standing
Aversion to Cold, especially below the waist
Urinary frequency with abundant, clear urine or
Maybe chronic diarrhea or "cock crow" diarrhea
Joint pain, especially in the ankle and knee
There may be numbness and heaviness in the limbs
The pain is worse with Cold and better with warmth
The pain is aggravated by Wind
Numbness of the muscles and skin
Hemiplegia, especially of the upper limbs
Deviation of the eyes and mouth
manifestations.tongue: Pale and swollen or Slightly purple or purple spots
manifestations.pulse: Deep and thready - maybe slow or Slippery or Slightly superficial or slightly rough or Slow and Soft or Wiry and tight or Floating and wiry

modifications.purpose: difficult or restricted stretching and bending
fixed pain or a history of trauma
numbness and heaviness of the limbs
muscle wilting and weakness of the lower limbs
